intro: Unjala longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved unjala, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale pink and appear in clusters. Unjala longifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
